data.title: 5 Route Map: Real Estate Impact
data.meta_description: NH-5 plays a vital role in real estate growth. Learn how its route map shapes investment decisions. Invest wisely.
data.text:
Interested In Buying A Property? Click Here!

Check Out Some Properties In Chandigarh

Introduction To NH-5

National Highway 5, often referred to as NH 5, is a critical national highway in India, seamlessly connecting the states of Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, and Himachal Pradesh. This extensive highway spans over 600 kilometres from east to west, serving as a crucial link for transportation and connectivity. Here's a comprehensive overview of NH 5, including its entry-exit points, route map, connected states, significance, and junctions.

NH 5 connects the vast northern plains of India with the rugged and mountainous terrain of the Himalayas. It stretches from Firozpur in Punjab to Shipki La in Himachal Pradesh, traversing three significant states and one Union Territory. Notably, NH 5 offers travellers a captivating journey through diverse geographical landscapes, all while providing seamless connectivity. As we delve further, we will explore the NH 5 route map, its significance, and the real estate impact.

Evolution Of NH-5

Image Source: iStock

The historical evolution of National Highway 5 (NH 5) traces back to its origins as part of the erstwhile NH 22. NH 22 spanned from Ambala in Haryana to Khab on the Indo-Tibetan border, serving as a crucial lifeline. In 1989, a significant transformation occurred when NH 5 was officially designated as a national highway, highlighting its growing importance in the Indian road network.

A more recent development took place in 2010 when NH 5 underwent renumbering as part of the National Highways Development Project (NHDP). This renumbering redefined the highway as NH 5, signifying its pivotal role as a major national highway connecting diverse regions and contributing to the country's transportation infrastructure. This journey reflects the continuous efforts to improve and expand India's roadways for better connectivity and accessibility.

NH-5 Route Map: Connecting Key Cities And Regions

National Highway 5 (NH 5) covers a substantial distance of 660.2 kilometres and falls under the jurisdiction of the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI). As a critical national highway, NH 5 seamlessly connects the western and eastern regions of India, spanning from Punjab to Himachal Pradesh, with Haryana and Chandigarh in between. If you intend to access NH 5, you must enter from Firozpur, and exiting NH 5 is done at Shipki La in Himachal Pradesh.

Let's explore the NH 5 route in more detail. Starting from Firozpur, the highway passes through several significant locations, including Moga, Jagraon, Kharar, and Ludhiana in Punjab, proceeding towards Chandigarh, with Mohali in close proximity. It then crosses into Haryana, encompassing Panchkula, Surajpur, Pinjore, and bypassing Kalka. Finally, NH 5 enters Himachal Pradesh in Solan and covers a route that includes Shimla, Theog, Narkanda, Kumarsain, Rampur Bushahr, and Chini before reaching its terminus at Shipki La on the India-China border in Himachal Pradesh.

Significance Of NH-5

Image Source: iStock

National Highway 5 (NH 5) plays a pivotal role as a lifeline for the residents of Himachal Pradesh's hilly regions, ensuring the uninterrupted supply of essential commodities such as food, fuel, and medicines. It serves as a critical artery that connects these remote areas with the rest of the country, offering a lifeline for the well-being of the local population.

Beyond its vital role in sustaining life in these regions, NH 5 also grants access to some of the most breathtaking and scenic areas within the Indian Himalayas. Travellers and residents alike can immerse themselves in the natural beauty and tranquillity that this highway unveils.

NH 5's journey in serving the nation began in 1989 when it was officially designated as a national highway. Prior to this, it was an integral part of the former NH 22, a highway that stretched from Ambala to Khab on the Indo-Tibetan border. In 2010, NH 5 underwent renumbering as part of the National Highways Development Project (NHDP), solidifying its importance as a vital transportation route in India's road network.

Major States And Their Cities Covered By NH-5

Image Source: iStock

National Highway 5 (NH 5) traverses through several states and a Union Territory, connecting diverse regions. Here are the states covered by NH 5 and the routes it takes:

Punjab: NH 5 enters from Firozpur, passing through Moga, Jagraon, Ludhiana, Kharar, and Morinda.

Chandigarh: NH 5 touches the Union Territory of Chandigarh, specifically Mohali.

Haryana: The highway crosses into Haryana, encompassing Panchkula, Surajpur, Pinjore, and the Kalka bypass.

Himachal Pradesh: NH 5 finally enters Himachal Pradesh, where it covers a route that includes Parwanoo, Solan, Shimla, Theog, Narkanda, Kumarsain, Rampur Bushahr, and Chini, ultimately reaching its terminus at Shipki La on the India-China border.

This comprehensive route highlights NH 5's role as a vital transportation link, connecting different terrains and regions along its journey.

Key Junctions Along NH-5

Image Source: Freepik

National Highway 5 (NH 5) intersects with several other national highways at various junctions, enhancing its connectivity and significance. Here's a list of some of the major junctions along NH 5:

NH 205: Junction at Shimla

NH 705: Junction at Theog

NH 305: Junction at Sainj

NH 505A: Junction at Powari

NH 505: Junction at Khab

NH 105: Junction at Pinjore

NH 907A: Junction at Kumarhatti

NH 152: Junction at Zirakpur

NH 7: Junction at Zirakpur

NH 205A: Junction at Kharar

NH 205: Junction at Kharar

NH 44: Junction at Doraha

NH 703: Junction at Moga

NH 105B: Junction at Moga

NH 54: Junction at Talwandi Bhai

NH 354B: Junction at Firozpur

NH 354: Junction at Firozpur

These junctions not only facilitate smoother travel along NH 5 but also contribute to the broader network of national highways in India, enhancing connectivity and accessibility for travellers and goods transport.

NH 5's Impact On Real Estate

Image Source: Freepik

The improved connectivity brought about by National Highway 5 (NH 5) has ignited a surge in property demand in nearby regions such as Moga, Ludhiana, Mohali, and beyond. This enhanced accessibility has attracted both investors and homebuyers, leading to robust growth and an upward trend in land prices.

Moreover, the burgeoning commercial sector along the NH 5 corridor has further bolstered the demand for hospitality and retail properties. This comprehensive development has not only reshaped the real estate market but has also left an indelible mark on the landscapes of the states connected by NH 5.

In essence, NH 5 has played a pivotal role in driving economic growth and transforming the real estate scenario in the regions it traverses, reflecting its significance as a vital transportation artery in India.

Pictures used only for recreational purposes
